name: sfchronicle
text:
A's second baseman Tony Kemp, who regularly batted ninth with the Houston Astros, brings “speed” and “patience” to that lineup spot with the A’s, writes @MatthewKawahara.

https://t.co/tXvkRqyoGv

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @ronkroichick: Golf needs more majors at public courses such as San Francisco's Harding Park. My column ahead of tomorrow's first round of PGA Championship, first major in Harding history: https://t.co/92X9NBLnaD

name: sfchronicle
text:
In interviews with Bay Area parkgoers about their mask choices, many said they feel safe without a face covering when sitting outside with friends they trust. 

Do you wear a mask when you are in Bay Area parks? https://t.co/1hzQYkwoE5

name: sfchronicle
text:
For the first time in his career, Raheem Mostert will begin a season in a lead-back role. However, he will do so without wife and son, who are staying back in Ohio due to coronavirus safety concerns. 

https://t.co/0BsYeyMg1k

name: sfchronicle
text: Oakland's newest takeout spot doubles as a food hub for Black-owned pop-ups. Chef Rashad Armstead’s Epic Ventures Test Kitchen will feature rotating pop-ups, including his own Grammie’s Down-Home Chicken & Seafood in Oakland and Crave BBQ. https://t.co/Xv11g5vd4K https://t.co/vqFhwR91HO

name: sfchronicle
text: RT @JohnSheaHey: Another adjustment was to be made with Heineman's positioning behind the plate after his third catcher's interference, matching Posey's career total: https://t.co/C1QxZXthQ4
